story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 6
story.storyDescription: Ever since her mother‚Äôs death, Noelle hasn‚Äôt wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needs‚Ä¶
story.creator: web-uploader
story.prePaywallNotification: Noelle is wearing something that once belonged to her MOTHER! üëö‚ù§Ô∏è Tap back into Hooked to hear the story behind THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER.
story.postPaywallNotification: Noelle‚Äôs view of Beatrice completely changes after she hear the story of THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER. Read more!

messages.text: Noelle feels her stomach drop.
This sweater belonged to Mom?
But Maria was the one who gave it to me‚Ä¶
Yes. Because I was the one who gave it to your sister.
And your mother‚Ä¶gave it to me.
It was back when the doctors found your mother‚Äôs cancer for the second time.
They‚Äôd diagnosed it as Stage 4.
And your mother came to visit me in this shop.
She needed to talk to a good friend about the future of her family.
Because you see, she was worried about your father.
She was?
Well, yes! She was in love with him.
You don‚Äôt need me to tell you that your father is a wonderful man, Noelle.
But he‚Äôs not independent like your mother was ‚Äî or like you.
He likes to be cared for, and there‚Äôs nothing wrong with that.
Your mother knew that he wouldn‚Äôt feel comfortable moving on romantically.
She knew he‚Äôd need her blessing.
So she devised a plan.
Noelle lets out a watery laugh.
As painful as it is to think of her mother‚Äôs final wishes‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs nice to hear Beatrice bring her mother to life‚Äî
If only in a memory.
That DOES sound like Mom!
She always had a plan up her sleeve.
Indeed, she did.
She knew that this sweater had important meaning to her.
And to your father.
What do you mean?
Your mother was wearing this sweater the night she met your father.
When they were both studying abroad in Ireland.
Woah‚Ä¶
Noelle looks down at the sweater she‚Äôs wearing.
She gets chills, thinking about how it brought her parents together.
That‚Äôs amazing. I knew they met in Ireland, but I‚Äôd never heard anything about this sweater.
I guess they kept that detail to themselves ‚Äî as their own little secret.
This sweater was handmade in Galway, the city where they studied.
It‚Äôs one of a kind.
And that‚Äôs how your mother knew your father would recognize it as a sign.
Oh my god‚Ä¶you mean‚Äî
Yes, dear. Your mother gave me the sweater and asked me, if I saw it as a possibility‚Ä¶
To open my heart up to your father after she was gone.
All she wanted was for him to be loved.
And‚Ä¶
Beatrice blushes.
I guess your mom had a sense for these things.
After a year of healing together, something changed in us.
My heart did start to open up to your father, in a way I had never imagined‚Ä¶
I just couldn‚Äôt stop thinking about him.
You know. Romantically.
So did Dad see you wearing the sweater?
Is that how he knew he had Mom‚Äôs blessing?
Yes, and as fate would have it‚Ä¶
I was wearing it when your dad came to the bookshop to ask me out!
He said that he was going to ask me to be patient with him‚Ä¶
Because he didn‚Äôt know if he was ready to date‚Ä¶
But when he saw the sweater, he knew he could trust his gut.
And the rest, as they say, is history.
Noelle feels a pressure building above her eyebrows.
She tries desperately not to cry.
And Beatrice‚Ä¶she notices.
She‚Äôs always anticipated Noelle‚Äôs needs.
It‚Äôs okay, dear. You can let it out.
As Beatrice wraps her in a hug, Noelle starts sobbing uncontrollably‚Äî
Sobbing with relief because she‚Äôs finally letting herself feel.
And the emotion that courses through her is‚Ä¶
Happiness.
Noelle recognizes that a little part of her has always felt happy that her dad found Beatrice.
But before, she‚Äôd always felt sickened with guilt whenever she felt that emotion.
And she‚Äôd covered it right up.
There, there.
Beatrice‚Äôs hand gently rubs her back.
The touch is so soothing.
Noelle feels her breathing fall back into a normal pace.
Suddenly, she hears someone pounding on the door.
A deep voice calls out into the store.
Aunt Beatrice?
The voice sounds vaguely familiar‚Ä¶
Noelle thinks that all the crying has simply turned her brain to mush.
But when she turns around to see who it is, she gasps‚Äî
Standing in the doorway‚Ä¶is her dinner date for tonight, Lawrence.
